column1: I tried to make a robot that ate watches... but it was too time-consuming.
column3: Time refers to a measurable duration in which events occur.
column4: Time is a fundamental concept in physics that helps us measure the duration of events.
column5: The meeting was set for a specific time, but it lasted much longer than planned.

column1: Why was the geologist hungry? he had a large apatite.
column3: Apatite is a mineral used in fertilizers and in various industrial applications.
column4: The scientist studied the apatite mineral to understand its properties.
column5: After a long day of work, he had an apatite for a hearty meal.

column1: What did the fish say when he swam into a wall? dam.
column3: A dam is a barrier built to hold back water and create a reservoir.
column4: The dam was built to control the flow of the river.
column5: When he hit the wall, he let out a loud dam of frustration.
